channel.title: Articles • Hrvoje Šimić
channel.description: A collection of long form articles by Hrvoje Šimić

item.title: Beware of programming puzzles
item.description: The most common piece of advice you'll receive if you want to learn programming is that you should do programming to learn it. While this is well-meaning advice, since doing programming is better than reading about it, it's incomplete.

item.title: Knowing the port one is sailing to
item.description: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.

item.title: Writing Bear templates with Automator and Ruby
item.description: Bear is one of my favorite apps. It's simple, has a fantastic minimalist design, and uses Markdown. I'm happy to support its development since it's one of the rare apps that delight me. But, I've also noticed that some features are missing.

item.title: Writing-guided reading
item.description: There are so many great books to read, but so little time to do it. How to pick a book from a list of hundreds or even thousands of recommended books to read?

item.title: Why I've decided to switch to Hey
item.description: When Hey came out, I wasn't sure that I'm going to use it. But, I was interested in trying it out. I thought it was an overpriced email client and that there is too much hype around it. The App store drama didn't help. Yet, I was interested in it since I would like to stop using Gmail as my primary email address.

item.title: The law of ever-increasing entropy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." These are the famous words of Leo Tolstoy. But why is that the case? It all boils down to the law of ever-increasing entropy.

item.title: Word rafting
item.description: I had a crazy idea in the morning two months ago. I was drinking a lot the night before, and that usually causes waking up earlier and with some unusual ideas. I've decided to start an online writing group.

item.title: Goodbye Apple Watch
item.description: After over a year of everyday use, I've recently stopped using the Apple Watch.

item.title: Writing regularly
item.description: I've stopped writing regularly. I've published a couple of articles about personal knowledge management and stopped. I've broken the habit. I'm trying to get back to it now, but at the time I felt that there is nothing else to say about the topic.

item.title: Lessons from my third failed startup
item.description: I've recently quit the US company that I've co-founded.
